result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Imari Ronrico Brown

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown not in court, in custody.  
Attorney Gregg H. Novack in court for Imari Ronrico Brown.  
Attorney William R. F. Ackell in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in court for a Scheduling Conference.
Court Granted substitution of attorney Tishberg for Attorney Novack.
Defense counsel in receipt of discovery from prior counsel and request for trial date.
Court is in receipt of defense motion for a Speedy Trial Demand which expires 12-13-2022.
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.
Final pre-trial scheduled for November 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and filed by Attorney Novak: Request for Substitution of Counsel.
Defendant enters a SPEEDY TRIAL DEMAND- EXPIRES 12-13-2022
Received and Filed by Attorney Gregg Novack.

Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg in court, defendant Imari Ronrico Brown not in court, in custody.  William R. F. Ackell appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Scheduling Conference. Defense in receipt of discovery and offer from the State. Parties engaged in negotiations and request an additional status date.  
Court ordered matter adjourned back to Branch 19.  Scheduling conference scheduled for October 13, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Violation Report 7.27.22

Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown in court by video with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg who appears in person.  Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown in custody.  Katrina Amy Voge appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Officer N. Ghassoul. State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.    
*Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 19, Judge Kori Ashley, in Room 313 of the Safety Building.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown not in court, defendant in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. Attorney Tishberg is not available; requests an adjournment. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 20, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 057972,
Payable Number: 1015285,
Receipt Number: 22RP025485,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  No driving without a valid license.

Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Defendant Imari Ronrico Brown in custody.  Michael R Staskunas appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Imari Ronrico Brown appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kies, Branch 45. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that as of July 30, 2022, this case will be assigned to Branch 6, Judge Ellen Brostrom, in Room 608 of the Courthouse.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
